newsitem.title: UK: Baltic, Black Sea oil exports steady on week.
newsitem.headline: Baltic, Black Sea oil exports steady on week.

text.p: Oil exports from Baltic and Black Sea terminals rose a modest 3,500 barrels a day (bpd) to 1.652 million bpd in the third week of February, Petro-Logistics said on Wednesday.
But total exports were 70,202 bpd down on the same week last year as crude and gas oil shipments sank, it said.

The Geneva-based consultancy, tracking tanker movements, said crude exports from Baltic and Black Sea ports fell by 31,662 bpd on the week to 816,029 bpd. They were also a sharp 266,004 bpd below last year's level.
Gas oil exports fell 90,655 bpd to 463,922 bpd in the week, representing a decline of 117,267 bpd over last year.
But heavy fuel exports rose 68,586 bpd to 263,353 bpd and were 215,683 bpd higher than last year.
Gasoline and jet exports combined totalled 85,963 bpd, up 33,938 bpd over the previous week and 74,090 bpd above last year.
The following table provided by Petro-Logistics lists a breakdown in metric tonnes of petroleum exports from the Baltic and Black Sea in the third week of February.
